summary: This is an FAA aircraft registration statement for Hyperion Air, LLC, certifying its eligibility to register aircraft as a U.S. citizen entity. The document identifies Jeffrey E. Epstein as the sole member and Lawrence Visoski as the sole manager of the company, which was organized in the U.S. Virgin Islands.

persons.name: Jeffrey E. Epstein
persons.role: Sole Member of Hyperion Air, LLC
persons.context: Listed as the sole member and a U.S. citizen individual owner of the aircraft-registering company Hyperion Air, LLC.

persons.name: Lawrence Visoski
persons.role: Sole Manager of Hyperion Air, LLC
persons.context: Identified as the sole manager of Hyperion Air, LLC and the signatory on the FAA registration statement.

connections.description: Epstein is the sole member (owner) of Hyperion Air, LLC, and Visoski is the sole manager of the company, indicating a business/employment relationship.

events.title: Formation of Hyperion Air, LLC
events.description: Hyperion Air, LLC was lawfully organized in the United States Virgin Islands.

events.title: FAA Aircraft Registration Filing
events.description: The LLC statement in support of aircraft registration for Hyperion Air, LLC was filed with the FAA Aircraft Registry in Oklahoma City.

locations: United States Virgin Islands (jurisdiction where Hyperion Air, LLC is organized)
Oklahoma City, Oklahoma (location of FAA Aircraft Registry where document was filed)
keyFacts: Jeffrey E. Epstein was the sole member (owner) of Hyperion Air, LLC, an aircraft-registering company.
Lawrence Visoski was the sole manager of Hyperion Air, LLC and signed the FAA registration document.
Hyperion Air, LLC was organized in the United States Virgin Islands on October 1, 2012.
The document certifies that the LLC meets U.S. citizenship requirements for aircraft registration, with Epstein verified as a U.S. citizen.
The registration statement was filed with the FAA Aircraft Registry in Oklahoma City on August 13, 2013.
